TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed UnicodeDecodingConformance extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Controls how Unicode characters are interpreted by the <xref:System.Net.WebUtility.HtmlDecode%2A> methods.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information on how Unicode characters are supposed to be encoded in HTML, see [Using character escapes in markup and CSS](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=256607).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeDecodingConformance Auto = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Use automatic behavior. The decoding behavior is determined by current application's target Framework. For [!INCLUDE[net_v45](../../add/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later, the Unicode encoding decoding is strict.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeDecodingConformance Compat = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Use compatible behavior. Specifies that incoming data is not checked for validity before being decoded. For example, an input string of "�" would decode as U+D84C, which is an unpaired surrogate. Additionally, the decoder does not understand code points in the SMP unless they're represented as HTML-encoded surrogates, so the inputstring "

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeDecodingConformance Loose = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Use loose behavior. Similar to Compat in that there are no validity checks, but the decoder also understands code points. The input string "

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.Configuration.UnicodeDecodingConformance Strict = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Use strict behavior. Specifies that the incoming encoded data is checked for validity before being decoded. For example, an input string of "
